title: Using curl to Send JSON Data to an API
context: The user wanted to learn how to send a POST request with JSON data to a REST API using curl.
keyIdea: You can use curl's -X POST and -H 'Content-Type: application/json' options along with -d to send JSON payloads to an API endpoint.
explanation: This command sends a POST request to the specified API endpoint with JSON data in the request body. The -H flag ensures the server interprets the data correctly.

reusabilityNotes.whenToReuse: Whenever you need to interact with an API that accepts JSON POST requests.
reusabilityNotes.pitfalls: Always escape quotes correctly inside JSON strings and make sure the Content-Type header matches the data format.
